Description: Shoulder sherd (mended from two fragments) of Corinthian Black Polychrome pottery closed vessel, probably a trefoil-mouthed broad-bottomed oinochoe; exterior glazed; on shoulder, double incised tongues in the pattern black/red/black/white; below, red band lined in white.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1924,1201.1210 and is possibly from the same vase as British Museum 1924,1201.1212 and 1213, though the colour sequence of the tongues on the sherds is different. For parallels, see Amyx, D. A. and Lawrence, P., Corinth: Results of Excavations Conducted by the American School of Classical Studies at Athens VII.2: Archaic Corinthian Pottery and the Anaploga Well. Princeton 1975, pl. 54, fig. An 101.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 117, no. A198)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.068) (Phase 1)
